title: How to Adjust the Filter Strength on Instagram on iPhone or iPad

steps.headline: Open Instagram.
steps.description: It’s the purple, pink, and orange camera icon on your home screen. If you’re not already signed in, enter your login information, or tap Log in as (your name) to continue.

steps.headline: Tap the new post button.
steps.description: It’s a plus (+) sign inside of a rounded rectangle. You can only adjust the filter strength when making a new post.

steps.headline: Select a photo and tap Next.
Select a filter.
steps.description: Tap the filter you want to use at the bottom of the screen. You should now see a preview of your photo with the selected filter.

steps.headline: Tap the half-filled sun icon.
steps.description: It’s at the top of the screen. A slider bar will appear below the photo.

steps.headline: Move the slider to adjust the filter strength.
steps.description: Slide it to the left to decrease the strength of the filter, and to the right to increase it.

steps.headline: Share your photo.
steps.description: Enter a caption, if desired, and then tap Share. The photo is now shared with the filter strength you specified.

text: Open Instagram. It’s the purple, pink, and orange camera icon on your home screen. If you’re not already signed in, enter your login information, or tap Log in as (your name) to continue. Tap the new post button. It’s a plus (+) sign inside of a rounded rectangle. You can only adjust the filter strength when making a new post. Select a photo and tap Next.  Select a filter. Tap the filter you want to use at the bottom of the screen. You should now see a preview of your photo with the selected filter. Tap the half-filled sun icon. It’s at the top of the screen. A slider bar will appear below the photo. Move the slider to adjust the filter strength. Slide it to the left to decrease the strength of the filter, and to the right to increase it. Tap Done.  Share your photo. Enter a caption, if desired, and then tap Share. The photo is now shared with the filter strength you specified.
